I haven't played long as of right now, but I just want to point out the fact that I played through the entire game in one sitting because I was so enthralled, which was just under 3 hours. I had no idea what time it was until I stopped, and that's pretty incredible. I was so into the game, I even started talking to the robots like they were my children. Also, I may have beaten the game, but there's still at least 10 hours of content left in it and I can't wait to start finishing that! I usually play games to have fun, but this game makes me feel like I must complete it. Either you buy it single or get the Orange Box (I prefer the Orange Box because it gives you a crap-ton of Half-Life games with it for just $21.39), you will not regret this purchase. Even if you're financially struggling and have no food, don't buy food, add this marvelous, kickass game to your empty library you hooligans!

Side Note: When I first got into the game, the resolution and whatnot was super weird and made the game pixely. However, I dabbled with the settings and took it out of and into full screen mode. I also changed up the resolution before going back into the full screen so that black bars would appear on the side, instead of zooming into the game. I also had a cursor problem when playing the game where my mouse cursor was showing (instead of being invisible so I can use the crosshairs), however, I just tabbed out and tabbed in to fix it. Never had these problems again and was able to experience this game in its full glory!

Update: I just 100% Portal and what else can I say but how much fun this game is. At first, I thought it was a bit ambitious to start, but after days of music and fun, I finally did it. It's not easy to 100%, I'll say that, but ANYONE can do it! Trust me when I say this, the game is built around its achievements. Everything is where it's at because of the achievements and that's so cool to me! It was an absolute joy to play and complete, after a few videos of tutorials for the challenges in the bonus maps. I don't usually 100% games at all, but I felt like I had to out of respect for this gem. Now, I get the luxurious feeling of the game being my playground! This is awesome! Thank you, Valve, for this incredible, deep, and fun experience. You never fail to impress me! ;)
